docs.snippet: Dollar General Corp. says it plans to create 10,000 jobs this year tied to the opening of 1,000 stores and two distribution centers....
docs.lead_paragraph: Dollar General Corp. says it plans to create 10,000 jobs this year tied to the opening of 1,000 stores and two distribution centers.

headline.main: Dollar General Says It Will Add 10,000 Jobs This Year

docs.snippet: West Virginia health officials are responding to opioid overdoses by distributing more than 8,000 kits with an antidote — Naloxone — that can get people breathing again if administered in time....
docs.lead_paragraph: West Virginia health officials are responding to opioid overdoses by distributing more than 8,000 kits with an antidote — Naloxone — that can get people breathing again if administered in time.

headline.main: West Virginia Distributing 8,000 Overdose Antidote Kits
headline.print_headline: West Virginia Distributing 8,000 Overdose Antidote Kits

docs.snippet: In a decade as a federal appeals court judge, Supreme Court nominee Neil Gorsuch has criticized courts for giving too much power to government agencies that enforce the nation's labor and employment laws. As a lawyer in private practice, he also b...
docs.lead_paragraph: In a decade as a federal appeals court judge, Supreme Court nominee Neil Gorsuch has criticized courts for giving too much power to government agencies that enforce the nation's labor and employment laws. As a lawyer in private practice, he also backed curbs on some class-action lawsuits.

headline.main: Gorsuch Seen as Business-Friendly on Labor, Workplace Issues
headline.print_headline: Gorsuch Seen as Business-Friendly on Labor, Workplace Issues

docs.snippet: German Chancellor Angela Merkel visits Warsaw on Tuesday for talks with Poland's top leaders, taking efforts to save the European Union to a country that is keen to keep as much national power as possible and fears being marginalized in a "two-spe...
docs.lead_paragraph: German Chancellor Angela Merkel visits Warsaw on Tuesday for talks with Poland's top leaders, taking efforts to save the European Union to a country that is keen to keep as much national power as possible and fears being marginalized in a "two-speed Europe."

headline.main: Merkel to Visit Euroskeptic Poland in Struggle to Save EU
headline.print_headline: Merkel to Visit Euroskeptic Poland in Struggle to Save EU

docs.snippet: The mother of a mentally ill woman who suffocated while handcuffed by Cleveland police says she wants the officers prosecuted after settling a lawsuit Monday for $2.25 million, the latest large settlement with the city over allegations of police m...
docs.lead_paragraph: The mother of a mentally ill woman who suffocated while handcuffed by Cleveland police says she wants the officers prosecuted after settling a lawsuit Monday for $2.25 million, the latest large settlement with the city over allegations of police misconduct.

headline.main: Cleveland Settles Woman's Excessive Force Lawsuit for $2.25M
headline.print_headline: Cleveland Settles Woman's Excessive Force Lawsuit for $2.25M

docs.snippet: Volkswagen is planning to cap the pay package of its chief executive at 10 million euros ($10.7 million) and keep pay for management board members below that, a source familiar with the matter said....
